org.bonitasoft.engine.bpm.bar
Class BusinessArchiveBuilder

java.lang.Object
  org.bonitasoft.engine.bpm.bar.BusinessArchiveBuilder

public class BusinessArchiveBuilder
extends Object

Creates BusinessArchive

A typical use of this class is to build programmatically Business archive in order to deploy it using the ProcessAPI

If you wish to deploy a BusinessArchived stored in a .bar file use BusinessArchiveFactory instead.

Usage example:

BusinessArchive businessArchive = BusinessArchiveBuilder().createNewBusinessArchive().setProcessDefinition(processDefinition).done();

Author:
Baptiste Mesta, Matthieu Chaffotte

addClasspathResource

public BusinessArchiveBuilder addClasspathResource(BarResource resource)
Add JAR dependencies to the business archive.

Everything that is added as classpath resource will be added in the (JAVA) classpath of the process

e.g. if you add a connector in your process add here dependencies the process need to execute it

Parameters:
resource - the BarResource the represent a JAR file
Returns:
the same BusinessArchiveBuilder in order to chain calls

addConnectorImplementation

public BusinessArchiveBuilder addConnectorImplementation(BarResource resource)
Add connector implementation descriptor to the business archive.

This resource must be a connector implementation descriptor file (.impl) and must be compliant to the connector-implementation-descriptor.xsd

A connector definition should also be added in the ProcessDefinition using ProcessDefinitionBuilder#addConnector(String, String, String, org.bonitasoft.engine.bpm.model.ConnectorEvent) or ActivityDefinitionBuilder#addConnector(String, String, String, org.bonitasoft.engine.bpm.model.ConnectorEvent)

e.g. if you add a connector in your process add here dependencies the process need to execute it

Parameters:
resource - the BarResource the represent a connector implementation descriptor file
Returns:
the same BusinessArchiveBuilder in order to chain calls

setActorMapping

public BusinessArchiveBuilder setActorMapping(byte[] xmlContent)
Set the actor mapping for this BusinessArchive

The file must be compliant with the xsd actorMapping.xsd The actor mapping specify for each actor of the process who it is in the organization.

It is not mandatory to set it in the BusinessArchive, it can be set after the process was deployed using ProcessManagementAPI.addUserToActor(long, long), ProcessManagementAPI.addGroupToActor(long, long), ProcessManagementAPI.addRoleToActor(long, long) or ProcessManagementAPI.addRoleAndGroupToActor(long, long, long)

Parameters:
xmlContent - the xml file content that describe the actor mapping
Returns:
the same BusinessArchiveBuilder in order to chain calls
